title.value: BAYES -MIL: A N EW P ROBABILISTIC P ERSPECTIVE ON ATTENTION - BASED M ULTIPLE I NSTANCE L EARN ING FOR W HOLE S LIDE I MAGES
title.justification: The title of the paper is explicitly mentioned right at the top.
title.quote: BAYES -MIL: A N EW P ROBABILISTIC P ERSPECTIVE ON ATTENTION - BASED M ULTIPLE I NSTANCE L EARN ING FOR W HOLE S LIDE I MAGES

extractions.description: The paper proposes a new probabilistic approach to attention-based multiple instance learning (MIL) for the classification of whole slide images (WSI) in medical diagnosis. The new method, called Bayes-MIL, introduces uncertainty measures at the patch level to improve the interpretability and accuracy of the model.

type.justification: The paper presents new experimental results on large-scale WSI datasets to show the effectiveness of the proposed Bayes-MIL method, alongside discussions and visualizations of these results.
type.quote: Experimental results show Bayes-MIL outperforms the related methods in patch-level and slide-level metrics and provides much better interpretable ROI on several large-scale WSI datasets.

name.justification: The primary application domain discussed throughout the paper is related to medical imaging, specifically the diagnosis of cancer using whole slide images.
name.quote: Multiple instance learning (MIL) is a popular weakly-supervised learning model on the whole slide image (WSI) for AI-assisted pathology diagnosis.

name.justification: The primary learning approach discussed is weakly supervised learning because the paper deals with scenarios where only slide-level (weak) labels are available as opposed to patch-level (strong) labels.
name.quote: Weakly-supervised learning methods are designed for learning representations and making decisions in these cases.

name.justification: One of the key aspects of the proposed model is an attention mechanism that improves interpretability and performance in MIL.
name.quote: The recent advance in attention-based MIL allows the model to find its region-of-interest (ROI) for interpretation by learning the attention weights for image patches of WSI slides.

name.justification: The paper introduces a Bayesian approach to model the uncertainty in attention weights and improve interpretability.
name.quote: In this paper, we propose Bayes-MIL to address the problem from a probabilistic perspective.

name.justification: Bayes-MIL is the proposed model in the paper.
name.quote: We propose Bayes-MIL to address the problem from a probabilistic perspective.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced as a new approach in the scope of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose Bayes-MIL to address the problem from a probabilistic perspective.

is_executed.justification: The model was empirically tested on several large-scale WSI datasets.
is_executed.quote: Experimental results show Bayes-MIL outperforms the related methods in patch-level and slide-level metrics.

is_compared.justification: Bayes-MIL was directly compared to other models like DSMIL and CLAM in terms of patch-level localization and slide-level classification.
is_compared.quote: We use the attention {ak}K k=1 as the patch-level prediction confidence and compare with the patch-level ground-truth {yk}K k=1 , using the related MIL approaches.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The attention mechanism referenced as a precursor to Bayes-MIL is from the paper 'Attention-based deep multiple instance learning'.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We follow the standard formulation of Attention-based Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) (Ilse et al., 2018).

name.justification: CAMELYON16 is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for evaluating the proposed methods.
name.quote: The experiments are conducted on CAMELYON16 dataset with 5 splits of training and validation sets.

referenced_paper_title.value: Diagnostic assessment of deep learning algorithms for detection of lymph node metastases in women with breast cancer
referenced_paper_title.justification: The CAMELYON16 dataset was created for this referenced study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: CAMELYON16 contains 400 hematoxylins and eosin (H&E) stained WSI of sentinel lymph node for breast cancer, labeled as normal or tumor classes.

name.justification: CAMELYON17 is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for evaluating the proposed methods.
name.quote: Results on CAMELYON17 show our method is better than the CLAM baseline in Patch-localization and Slide-classification, shown in the Appendix.

referenced_paper_title.value: From detection of individual metastases to classification of lymph node status at the patient level: the camelyon17 challenge
referenced_paper_title.justification: The CAMELYON17 dataset was created for this referenced study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: CAMELYON17 contains 1000 WSI of the same type, labeled with normal or different stages (pN-stage) of the breast tumor.
